Alternatively, in the quicksort, we can change the comparison to be greater than instead of less than. Alternatively, here's a modified quicksort for descending order:

subroutine quicksort_desc(arr, left, right)

    integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

    integer, intent(in) :: left, right

    integer :: i, j, pivot, temp

    i = left

    j = right

    pivot = arr( (left + right) / 2 )

    do

        do while (arr(i) > pivot) i = i +1

        end do

        do while (arr(j) < pivot)

            j = j -1

        end do

        if (i <= j) then

            temp = arr(i)

            arr(i) = arr(j)

            arr(j) = temp

            i = i +1

            j = j -1

        end if

        if (i > j) exit

    end do

    if (left < j) call quicksort_desc(arr, left, j)

program main

    implicit none

    integer :: N, size, i, j, active_count, next, count, result

    integer, allocatable :: S(:), active(:), sorted_active(:), activated(:)

    logical, allocatable :: spawned(:)

    character(len=3) :: first_result

    character(len=100) :: stack

    integer :: top

    ! First part processing

    read(*,*) N

    size = 2**N

    allocate(S(size)) read(*,*) (S(i), i=1, size)

    ! Sort S in ascending order

    call quicksort(S, 1, size)

    allocate(spawned(size), source = .false.)

    spawned(size) = .true.

    allocate(active(size)) active_count =1

    active(1) = S(size)

    first_result = 'Yes'

    do i=1, N

        !
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
Sort active in descending order

        allocate(sorted_active(active_count)) sorted_active = active(1:active_count)

        call quicksort_desc(sorted_active, 1, active_count)

        allocate(activated(active_count)) next = size

        do j=1, active_count

            integer :: slime = sorted_active(j)

            do while (next >=1 .and. (S(next) > = slime .or. spawned(next))) next = next -1

            end do

            if (next <1) then

                first_result = 'No'

                goto 100

            end if

            spawned(next) = .true.

            activated(j) = S(next)

        end do

        ! Add activated to active

        do j=1, active_count

            active(active_count +j) = activated(j)

        end do

        active_count = active_count *2

        deallocate(sorted_active, activated)

    end do

100 continue

    ! Now process the second part

    ! Initialize stack variables

    stack = ' '

    top =0

    count =0

    do i=1, len_trim(first_result)

        character(len=1) :: c = first_result(i:i)

        top = top +1

        stack(top:top) = c

        do while (top >=2)

            character(len=1) :: p = stack(top:top)

            character(len=1) :: q = stack(top-1:top-1)

            if ( (p == '1' .and. q == '0') .or. (p == '0' .and. q == '1') ) then

                count = count +1

                top = top -2

            else

                exit

            end if

        end do

    end do

    result = count *2

    print *, result

    deallocate(S, spawned, active)

contains

    subroutine quicksort(arr, left, right)
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:

    end subroutine quicksort

    subroutine quicksort_desc(arr, left, right)
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

        integer, intent(in) :: left, right

        integer :: i, j, pivot, temp

        i = left

        j = right

        pivot = arr( (left + right)/2 )

        do

            do while (arr(i) > pivot) i = i +1

            end do

            do while (arr(j) < pivot)

                j = j -1

            end do

            if (i <= j) then

                temp = arr(i)

                arr(i) = arr(j)

                arr(j) = temp

                i = i +1

                j = j -1

            end if

            if (i > j) exit

        end do

        if (left < j) call quicksort_desc(arr, left, j)

        if (i < right) call quicksort_desc(arr, i, right)

    end subroutine quicksort_desc

end program main

Alternatively, use a quicksort implementation. Here's a quicksort subroutine in Fortran:

subroutine quicksort(arr, left, right)

    integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

    integer, intent(in) :: left, right

    integer :: i, j, pivot, temp

    i = left

    j = right

    pivot = arr( (left + right) / 2 )

    do

        do while (arr(i) < pivot) i = i +1

        end do

        do while (arr(j) > pivot)

            j = j -1

        end do

        if (i <= j) then

            temp = arr(i)

            arr(i) = arr(j)

            arr(j) = temp

            i = i +1

            j = j -1

        end if

        if (i > j) exit

    end do

    if (left < j) call quicksort(arr, left, j)

    if (i < right) call quicksort(arr, i, right)

end subroutine quicksort

subroutine quicksort(arr, left, right)

    integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

    integer, intent(in) :: left, right

    integer :: i, j, pivot, temp

    i = left

    j = right

    pivot = arr( (left + right) / 2 )

    do

        do while (arr(i) < pivot)

            i = i +1

        end do

        do while (arr(j) > pivot)

            j = j -1

        end do

        if (i <= j) then

            temp = arr(i)

            arr(i) = arr(j)

            arr(j) = temp

            i = i +1

            j = j -1

        end if

        if (i > j) exit

    end do

    if (left < j) call quicksort(arr, left, j)

    if (i < right) call quicksort(arr, i, right)

end subroutine quicksort

subroutine quicksort_desc(arr, left, right)

    integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

    integer, intent(in) :: left, right

    integer :: i, j, pivot, temp

    i = left

    j = right

    pivot = arr( (left + right) / 2 )

    do

        do while (arr(i) > pivot)

            i = i +1

        end do

        do while (arr(j) < pivot)

            j = j -1

        end do

        if (i <= j) then

            temp = arr(i)

            arr(i) = arr(j)

            arr(j) = temp

            i = i +1

            j = j -1

        end if

        if (i > j) exit

    end do

    if (left < j) call quicksort_desc(arr, left, j)

    if (i < right) call quicksort_desc(arr, i, right)

end subroutine quicksort_desc

Thus, the code outline is:

program main

    implicit none

    integer :: N, size, i, j, active_count, next, count, result

    integer, allocatable :: S(:), active(:), sorted_active(:), activated(:)

    logical, allocatable :: spawned(:)

    character(len=3) :: first_result

    character(len=100) :: stack

    integer :: top

    ! First part processing

    read(*,*) N

    size = 2**N

    allocate(S(size))

    read(*,*) (S(i), i=1, size)

    ! Sort S in ascending order

    call quicksort(S, 1, size)

    allocate(spawned(size), source = .false.)

    spawned(size) = .true.

    allocate(active(size))

    active_count =1

    active(1) = S(size)

    first_result = 'Yes'

    do i=1, N

        ! Sort active in descending order

        allocate(sorted_active(active_count))

        sorted_active = active(1:active_count)

        call quicksort_desc(sorted_active, 1, active_count)

        allocate(activated(active_count))

        next = size

        do j=1, active_count

            integer :: slime = sorted_active(j)

            do while (next >=1 .and. (S(next) >= slime .or. spawned(next)))

                next = next -1

            end do

            if (next <1) then

                first_result = 'No'

                goto 100

            end if

            spawned(next) = .true.

            activated(j) = S(next)

        end do

        ! Add activated to active

        do j=1, active_count

            active(active_count +j) = activated(j)

        end do

        active_count = active_count *2

        deallocate(sorted_active, activated)

    end do

100 continue

    ! Now process the second part

    ! Initialize stack variables

    stack = ' '

    top =0

    count =0

    do i=1, len_trim(first_result)

        character(len=1) :: c = first_result(i:i)

        top = top +1

        stack(top:top) = c

        do while (top >=2)

            character(len=1) :: p = stack(top:top)

            character(len=1) :: q = stack(top-1:top-1)

            if ( (p == '1' .and. q == '0') .or. (p == '0' .and. q == '1') ) then

                count = count +1

                top = top -2

            else

                exit

            end if

        end do

    end do

    result = count *2

    print *, result

    deallocate(S, spawned, active)

contains

    subroutine quicksort(arr, left, right)

        integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

        integer, intent(in) :: left, right

        integer :: i, j, pivot, temp

        i = left

        j = right

        pivot = arr( (left + right)/2 )

        do

            do while (arr(i) < pivot)

                i = i +1

            end do

            do while (arr(j) > pivot)

                j = j -1

            end do

            if (i <= j) then

                temp = arr(i)

                arr(i) = arr(j)

                arr(j) = temp

                i = i +1

                j = j -1

            end if

            if (i > j) exit

        end do

        if (left < j) call quicksort(arr, left, j)

        if (i < right) call quicksort(arr, i, right)

    end subroutine quicksort

    subroutine quicksort_desc(arr, left, right)

        integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

        integer, intent(in) :: left, right

        integer :: i, j, pivot, temp

        i = left

        j = right

        pivot = arr( (left + right)/2 )

        do

            do while (arr(i) > pivot)

                i = i +1

            end do

            do while (arr(j) < pivot)

                j = j -1

            end do

            if (i <= j) then

                temp = arr(i)

                arr(i) = arr(j)

                arr(j) = temp

                i = i +1

                j = j -1

            end if

            if (i > j) exit

        end do

        if (left < j) call quicksort_desc(arr, left, j)

        if (i < right) call quicksort_desc(arr, i, right)

    end subroutine quicksort_desc

end program main
